author: abcoathup
content:
RollCall #9: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/rollcall-9-december-11-2024/21322

Can anyone provide a summary of actions/decisions?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<thegaram33> here are my notes:

- Pectra scope is almost final (see EIP-7600). earliest it will happen in March/April 2025.

- EIP-7702 will be included in Pectra. spec is almost final, no big changes expected.

- Pectra will increase target/max block count from 3/6 to 6/9 (i.e. base fee can change -14% ~ +8% in each block). more throughput for DA!

- there's a proposal EIP-7762 to set a floor price for blob base fee so that it does not fluctuate that much during price discovery. based on this call this EIP probably won't be included in Pectra.

- discussed some possible changes to how blob gas is tracked in the `eth_feeHistory` API. it seems most rollups don't use this API extensively.

- "Common Core" discussion (aka L2ECC) is still ongoing, the next breakout call will happen on 22 Jan, and there is a working group Telegram channel.

I guess there are no action items, apart form getting involved in L2ECC. (re @ethrnd_rollcall_bot: <abcoathup> RollCall #9: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/rollcall-9-december-11-2024/21322

Can anyone provide a summary of actions/decisions?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<cyp0x> thank you!! what is the common core telegram group? (re @thegaram33: here are my notes:

- Pectra scope is almost final (see EIP-7600). earliest it will happen in March/April 2025.

- EIP-7702 will be included in Pectra. spec is almost final, no big changes expected.

- Pectra will increase target/max block count from 3/6 to 6/9 (i.e. base fee can change -14% ~ +8% in each block). more throughput for DA!

- there's a proposal EIP-7762 to set a floor price for blob base fee so that it does not fluctuate that much during price discovery. based on this call this EIP probably won't be included in Pectra.

- discussed some possible changes to how blob gas is tracked in the eth_feeHistory API. it seems most rollups don't use this API extensively.

- "Common Core" discussion (aka L2ECC) is still ongoing, the next breakout call will happen on 22 Jan, and there is a working group Telegram channel.

I guess there are no action items, apart form getting involved in L2ECC.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<thegaram33> this one :) (re @adietrichs: As discussed on the call just now, two next steps for the L2 Execution Common Core (formerly L2 EVM Common Core):

- we have a working group for exploring the possible scope for a L2ECC v1: https://t.me/+gadsOqat4K01ZDhi

- we'll have a second L2ECC brekout call on January 22: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1215)
